bibl.title: The Beautiful Burial in Roman Egypt. Art, Identity, and Funerary Religion. (Oxford Studies in Ancient Culture and Representation.)
bibl.note: 1. Introduction: Art, Identity, and Funerary Religion Art. - 2. Osiris, Hathor, and the Gendered Dead. - 3. Portraying the Dead. - 4. Art and Archaism in Western Thebes. - 5. Conclusions: The 'Beautiful Burial' in Roman Egypt. - Appendix: List of Objects. Bibliography. Register of Museums. General Index.
bibl.seg: RIGGS Christina, The Beautiful Burial in Roman Egypt. Art, Identity, and Funerary Religion. (Oxford Studies in Ancient Culture and Representation.)
Oxford, Oxford University Press, 2005, 8°, xxiii-334 pp., 126 figg., 1 carte et 8 pll. coul. ISBN 0-19-927665-X. £80.
